articles.author: Luke McGee, CNN
articles.title: EU unveils ambitious climate package as it cools on fossil fuels - CNN
articles.description: The European Union has unveiled some of the world's most ambitious proposals to reduce carbon emissions and wean its 27 members off fossil fuels, including taxes on emissions-heavy imports into the union and non-renewable energy, such as oil, gas and coal.
articles.content: (CNN)The European Union has unveiled some of the world's most ambitious proposals to reduce carbon emissions and wean its 27 members off fossil fuels, including taxes on emissions-heavy imports into … [+6658 chars]

articles.title: EU unveils tough new climate rules, including tax on foreign polluters - CBC.ca
articles.description: The European Union is unveiling ambitious new climate change rules on Wednesday that will include forcing more emitters to pay for their carbon output, and forcing foreign companies to pay a levy for their carbon when they sell products into Europe.
articles.content: European Union policy-makers on Wednesday unveiled their most ambitious plan yet to tackle climate change, aiming to turn green goals into concrete action this decade, and in doing so lead the way fo… [+5161 chars]

articles.author: Science X staff
articles.title: Ariane 6 targets new missions with Astris kick stage - Phys.org
articles.description: ESA will enhance the versatility of Europe's Ariane 6 rocket with a kick stage called Astris in a €90 m development contract with prime contractor, ArianeGroup. This is part of ESA's strategy to extend Ariane 6's capabilities to serve a wider range of space t…

articles.title: US, European space agencies join forces on climate change - Global Times
articles.description: NASA and the European Space Agency (ESA) joined forces Tuesday in the battle against climate change, a move they said paves the way to a global response to the problem.

articles.author: Ciaran McGrath
articles.title: Bullish Macron stakes EU army leadership claim: 'Only France and US can do this' - Daily Express
articles.description: EMMANUEL Macron has stoked concerns about the prospect of a European army led by himself after touting his country's peacekeeping role in Mali - and bragging: 'Only France and the US can do this.'
